name: Always validate client-side data on the server
description: Ensure all client-side data is validated on the server. Client-side validation is not sufficient for security as it can be bypassed by attackers. Server-side validation is mandatory for data integrity and security.

missingValidationPipe.description: NestJS routes missing ValidationPipe or DTO validation

unsafeBodyUsage.description: Using @Body() with 'any' type instead of validated DTO

directReqUsage.description: Direct use of req.body/req.query/req.params without validation

clientTrusted.description: Sensitive fields (userId, role, price, isAdmin) trusted from client

stringConcatenation.description: SQL queries using string concatenation or template literals with user input

missingValidation.description: File uploads missing server-side validation (type, size, content)

violations.issue: Using @Body() with 'any' type - vulnerable to parameter tampering

violations.code: const { userId, discount } = req.body; const order = await this.service.create(userId, discount);
violations.issue: Trusting sensitive fields (userId, discount) from client without validation

violations.code: const query = `SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ${req.params.id}`;
violations.issue: SQL injection via string concatenation with user input

fixes.code: app.useGlobalPipes(new ValidationPipe({ whitelist: true, forbidNonWhitelisted: true }));
@Post('/checkout') checkout(@Body() dto: CheckoutDto, @Req() req) { const userId = req.user.sub; }
fixes.description: Use DTO validation and get userId from authenticated session

fixes.code: const query = 'SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?'; await db.query(query, [req.params.id]);

owaspMapping.description: Validates that all user input is properly validated server-side to prevent injection attacks and parameter tampering
